alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued September 15 at 3:49PM AKDT until September 17 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM FRIDAY TO 4 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * LOCATION...The Kuskokwim Delta Coast, including Kuskokwim Bay. Highest water levels will be from the Kuskokwim River mouth and to the northwest. * COASTAL FLOODING...Water levels are expected to rise 5 to 8 feet above the normal highest tide line. * TIMING...From Friday evening through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Low lying areas could flood. Some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion could occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A powerful storm system, now the extra- tropical remnants of Typhoon Merbok, will move from near the Western Aleutians today, through the Southern Bering tonight and Friday morning, and to the Bering Strait on Saturday. Winds are expected to increase by late Friday morning and peak Saturday morning before slowly diminishing through Saturday night. The combination of strong winds and fetch will produce a storm surge along the coast, leading to coastal flooding and the potential for coastal erosion along the Kuskokwim Delta coast.
info.instruction: A coastal flood warning means that flooding is occurring or imminent. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert for rising water, and take appropriate action to protect life and property.
